We would like to have an opportunity to officially congratulate our 3 State Championship Teams, Unified Basketball, Girls Ice Hockey and Boys Ice Hockey! It was a great run for all three teams with the fan support from the student body and community. Every athlete should have an experience to play in front of a “Berlin Crowd”, there is nothing like it!
We will be recognizing in the foreseeable future each of our state champions. We are in the process of purchasing State Champion T-shirts and lawn signs for each of our State Champions. The plan is to deliver each of these items to their houses individually with an escort by our local police and fire departments and a Berlin School bus. We have purchased two 3x10’ banners to be hung up in the city to celebrate these accomplishments. 3 State Champions in one season is remarkable! Congratulations to all of our State Champions and your families! The Berlin and Gorham communities are very proud of you all!
Craig Melanson
Director of Athletics
Berlin High School

Home Visiting participation is also linked to higher rate of employment, greater participation in education and job trainings, higher monthly incomes, and reductions in the use of welfare and cash assistance programs. The Berlin Gorham Mountain Bike team wrapped up their season Saturday with the Final in Franklin Falls NH. We would like to congratulate all our racers who put forth a great effort for our first season.
Our top finishers for this season were Berlin's 8th grader Parker Welch who was awarded Top Middle School racer in the east and an overall rank of 9th out of 259 male racers. Congratulations to the whole team!

post_text: Last year Berlin Elementary student, Molly, read a book that was about a little girl who had a "buddy bench" made for her school. This bench gives kids a place to sit when they're feeling sad/lonely and would like a friend to be their "buddy." Molly was on a mission! With the help of her teacher, Mrs Brenda Lambert, and the craftsmanship of Mr Matt Lambert and his BHS Building Trade's students, her vision came true! The bench was delivered to BES this week. Way to show kindness, Molly and crew❤
